conclusion: Objects A and B are positioned above the table, and objects C, D, E, and F are already on the table.

Due to gravity, objects A and B will come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F when placed down.
When objects A and B come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F, they will push the objects underneath them.
Objects A and B, being heavier, will cause objects C, D, E, and F to shift positions or potentially fall over, depending on their stability and the force of impact.
